On Tue, 2003-10-14 at 16:59, Ken Gentle wrote:
> That's a very interesting question -- JUnit is Java, 
> write-once-run-anywhere, remember? ;^)
> 
> You don't need a special distribution.  Just download JUnit, get your 
> JDK/JRE visible from a cygwin shell prompt, and set it up just like the 
> instructions describe.

Not exactly.  There are issues with how Cygwin deals with the
classpath.  Cygwin does not pass along the classpath properly to your
Windows version JVM.  You need to do something like this "java
-classpath `cygpath -wp $CLASSPATH` [arguments]" which changes the
classpath into a Windows style path.  A quick google on "cygwin java
classpath" would have turned up "http://www.inonit.com/cygwin/faq/",
probably as the first hit.

=jason
